Whitening toothpastes are designed to remove stains from the surface of teeth. A dentist plans to investigate the following claim made by a manufacturer of whitening toothpaste. Regular non-whitening toothpaste is less effective at removing stains from the surface of teeth than our whitening toothpaste. The dentist is considering the following two options for the design of a study: Proposal <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mtext mathvariant="bold">I</mtext></math> Proposal <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mtext mathvariant="bold">II</mtext></math> Randomly assign <math alttext="120" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>120</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with surface stains on their teeth to one of two groups, each with <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> people. Give the whitening toothpaste to one group to be used each day and the regular toothpaste to the other group to be used each day. After one month, observe the number of people from each group who do not have surface stains on their teeth. Select <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with surface stains on their teeth who use the whitening toothpaste each day and select <math alttext="60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with surface stains on their teeth who use the regular toothpaste each day. After one month, observe the number of people from each group who do not have surface stains on their teeth. (a) Give a reason why Proposal <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is less appropriate than Proposal <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for investigating the effectiveness of the whitening toothpaste. Justify your answer in the context of the problem.
